roleset.name: be a renter
roleset.note: LEASE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'lease' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Member of VNcls get-13.5.1. Comparison to 'buy' (from lease.01-v)
LEASING-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from leasing.01-n)

roles.note: The syntax only seems to allow for two prepositional args; I can't get a grammatical reading with both 'price' and 'term,' even though clearly the 'term' is a required semantic arg: 'John leased an apartment for a month.' (from lease.01-v)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: Once its ownership is finalized, [the new company]-1 will open talks with state-appointed receivers *trace*-1 to buy or lease Waertsilae Marine's shipyard facilities.

example.name: all args except term
example.text: John leased an apartment from Mary for a buck a minute.

roleset.name: be a landlord
roleset.note: LEASE-V NOTES: Nominal 'leasing' found in BOLT-7. Member of VNcls give-13.1-1. Comparison to 'sell'. (from lease.02-v)
LEASING-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from leasing.02-n)

example.name: automatically generated
example.text: But he said IBM would have won the business anyway as a sale to a third party that would have then leased the equipment to the customer .

example.name: all args except term
example.text: Mary leased an apartment to John for buck a minute.

example.name: nominal rel: leasing
example.text: ... the control of transparency of the property market and real estate costs , correct government finance , which heavily relying on land leasing and real estate taxes and fees , and prevent the lack of action or incidents of improper action on the part of public servants or government workers ' .
